labels.label: 4. Save JSON as AVRO to HDFS
2. Remove (filter) non-crypto currencies, add timestamp to every record
4. HDFS - Master dataset is stored in directory: /user/vagrant/projekt/masterdataset/crypto_rates which is saved in parameter: master_dataset_path

Get data about rates of cryptocurrencies and save to HDFS.
Details: 1. Every 10 seconds API request is sent. 2. JSON response contains 17 crypto and 150+ non-crypto currencies rates in USD. 3. JSON is split by currency, 4. JSONs are filtered by type (only crypto is left), 5. Timestamp is added to the JSON, 6. Since these JSONs are tiny, they are merged before saving to HDFS every minute (simulation of merging). 7. Merged JSON is converted to AVRO - every row contains information about: timestamp, cryptocurrency name, it's rate in USD and others (symbol, type, short name, name+timestamp_id)
Does the same as 6 processors above. Not used for clarity.
1. Get API response with JSON for all currencies including non-crypto currencies
3. Group few api responses to not create many tiny files in HDFS

config.comments: This processor is unnecessary. It was created during testing to quickly check names of currencies in the queue after filtering.
